runs.comm: pleasing seam away from the bat, Masakadza steps forward and across towards the good length ball outside off and then shoulders arms
makes the batsman work a bit harder this time by targeting the stumps. Masakadza nudges towards midwicket
a thick outside edge manifests as the good length ball seaming away outside off is sent to deep third man
no more Mr Orthodox. Gets down on one knee and lap sweeps a good length ball from middle to long leg
teaser outside off, Masakadza goes for the booming drive over cover. No contact
finds himself in a tangle as he lunges forward against a back of a length delivery veering away. Masakadza trusts his power though to whip it over long-off
a different challenge here as Sandeep prefers to dart the ball back into the right-hander. Starts a bit too straight and Masakdaza works it off his hips to long leg
tucks him up with a shorter ball in the off-stump corridor. Knocks it down with soft hands towards point. Good disctiplines from Sandeep
waits just long enough for the ball to pitch at a shortish length and cut back in at him. Uses that to his benefit as he flicks through midiwcket
hits a decent length but the ball zips past the batsmans inside edge as he was looking for a leg glance.
just back of a length on middle, Masakadza can only block. Captain runs in and pats him on the back

comes down like a truck careening downhill and pummels a short ball to short midwicket. Phew, good work from Vijay there to get a hand to that. Technically that might have been a catch, but it was dying on him.
change up there, but the awayswinger is short and meanders way outside off stump. Chibhabha was looking to lash it over point. Cant connect

striking power with the bottom hand. He did not have much room to work with as Sandeep keeps it short of a length and gets it to dart back in. Chibhabha goes for a flick, and picks the gap past wide long-on

short, cant bowl there at his pace. Cant bowl that with that much width. Cant bowl that with a batsman with the power of Masakadza. Didnt even need to move his feet, only got more of a bottom edge. And yet the pull finds the square leg boundary
walks at the bowler, Bhuvneshwar goes shorter and wider outside off. Dangerous line with this field, with no one on the off side boundary. A little extra bounce beats the flash over cover
banged in short and it soars over the batsmans left shoulder as he pulls out of a pull. Pretty close to being wided

a little question from the keeper as the good length ball slips down leg. Masakadza looks rather aggrieved that the umpire did not call that a wide. And he is within his rights that time. No connection with his pad or bat, while playing a leg glance
back of a length and outside off, dabbed towards point
continues to walk at the medium pacer, but Bhuvi wont be so forthcoming. Digs it in short and the batsman has to get up off his toes and dab to point
looks for the yorker, but his radar goes slightly off. Wanders down leg, Masakadzas flick cant connect. And more importantly, Sandeep has overstepped
free hit in the slot, put it its place over long-on. Masakadza chuckles as he touches gloves with his partner. Job well done

beautiful bowling! Job well done from Sandeep this time. As the captains have suggested, this deck is a little truer. Offers the quickie a tad bit more zip. Masakadza was on the walk, so it would appear even quicker. Credit to the bowler for shortening his length and tucking the batsman up. Tries to dab it to third man. Only feathers it through to the keeper
fuller delivery on middle, nudged to mid-on
point throws himself to his right, but Raza has managed to place it just wide of him. Just a hint of width afforded that time.
rewarded for not trying to do too much out of the ordinary. Chibhabha keeps to his crease and takes advantage of the bowler erring. Short ball, pulled behind square leg

spectacular comeback! Bowls an outswinger that would has the impact of pulling a rabbit out of the hat. Sucks the batsman forward, hits a good length and zips away past his outside edge and Chibhabha is left groping
poor bowling, offers a dolly of a short ball that is pulled miles in front of midwicket. Not that Raza has made the most pristine connection, but it still has enough
plants an open face down on an short, outswinger and finds a single to deep third man
probes a middle stump line to enhance the threat on his awayswingers. Defended
comes off the outside half of the bat, Chibhabha was looking to smash it over mid-off but it ends up skewed over extra cover. Width on a length ball is always a no-no
back of a length and outside off, whipped away to deep midwicket
they are not being all that smart with their lengths so far. Digs it in, allows the batsman to free his arms as well. Chibhabha swipes it away over midwicket
short and wide again, sliced away to deep third man
back of a length and just outside off, sliced to point

lucky, very lucky. Inviting width, pitched short enough for the batsman to get under as well. Raza puts everything into a slash. But to his chagrin, he gets more off the outside half and it flies down to deep third man
waits on a back of a length delivery and runs it down to deep third man
finally the fuller ball comes out of hiding, all the more logical because it as a new batsman at the crease. Williams drives to cover
jumps back, makes some room and cuts a shortish delivery on off stump to the sweeper
pushed away to the sweeper on the off side
outside off enough for Chibhabha to back away and slice to deep point again
inviting flight from Vjiay as he bowls around the wicket, Williams is a lovely player of spin as he flows down the track and slice it through cover
sweetly driven to wide long-off. He is coming forward nice and confidently and that high elbow was quite picturesque
more work down with his feet to get the pitch of a tossed up offspinner and its driven to long-off

pushed through on a length, and the best depiction of the pace at which he bowls is that the ball simply runs away to the long leg boundary. Williams plays a false shot - reverse sweep - and Uthappa cant get behind it
worked it into the leg side to get off strike
goes back and knocks it into the vacant midwicket region. Axar has to put in the not-so-hard yards himself
takes a short ball outside off and pulls it off the front foot to deep square leg
flat and quick on the pads, easy nudge behind square leg

Uthappa is absolutely convinced there was something on this! The umpire is convinced as well, that there wasnt. It was a fuller ball, fastish one as well. Williams goes for a reverse sweep, gets under the ball a bit too much. Keeper fumbles the first take, but manages to take it on the second
incredible delivery. Loads it up with a lot of flight outside off. Chibhabha was looking to stay leg side and drive through extra. But the ball dips and turns startlingly through bat and pad
gets down the track, to the pitch and deftly lobs the ball over Vijays head
tossed up almost into the blockhole, kept out
good length ball just outside off, whipped towards midwicket
charges the spinner, turns a flighted delivery on off stump into a full toss and drives to long-on
prefers to stay leg side of the good length ball and dabs it to point
leans forward and lifts a flighted delivery to long-off. Looked quite good there
too short that time and he camps back to pull to deep square leg
cant keep bowling that length. Spinner or fast bowler, on a slow pitch, it will sit up for the batsman. Chibhabha jumps back and pulls strongly through midwicket
loads of bottom hand in a whip as he takes a flatter ball outside off and directs it wide of long-on
slapped to long-off after Williams watches the shortish ball outside off very carefully
looks for the yorker, thats one of his strengths and its good to see him trusting it. Gets it to angle in on leg stump as well and finds the inside edge. Single to short fine leg
low full toss outside off, swiped away to long-on
low full toss outside off, bunted down to long-off
slips up by providing length and Williams has taken full toll. Walks across and launches it over square leg. Did play a bit across the line, but he struck it very well
lots fuller on off stump that time, punched down the ground

that is poor from Williams. Gets down the track and pops a dolly back to the bowler. Credit to Axar, as he pulled his length back and refused to give the batsman the scoring options he  was looking to create. Once that happened, Williams should had adjusted. He didnt. Still went hard at it, and pays the price
pushed through on off stump, worked away to long-on
flighted delivery on middle, driven to short cover
stays back and cuts a shortish delivery through to deep point
stays back and cuts a flatter ball on off stump through the covers
short of a good length and outside off, Chibhabha tries to force it through point but the back foot punch isnt properly placed
slower ball, short and wide and on its knees begging for punishment. Chibhbha wears a bemused smile after cracking it away through cover. Strange bowling plans this
pokes at a wide delivery outside off, uses only half a bat on it and is beaten
this time behind point. Good batting from Chibhabha, but hes hardly being challenged. Short again, wide again.  Waits a touch longer and places it wide of deep third man as well
back foot punch to the right of point for a single. Hes shaping up quite nicely, even if his strike rate isnt the most threatening
good ball to finish. Keeps it back of a length and outside off, gets the batsman poking outside off and beats him
flat and quick just outside off, Chibhabha slices it to point
flighted into the blockhole on middle, pushed down to long-on
slower through the air and he gets a bit of turn as a result. Dabbed to point with an open face
goes for an extravagant reverse sweep off a good length ball on middle, poor choice of shot and as a result no connection

beaten in the flight as Axar pulls his length back having seen the batsman charging. Coventry goes through with a chip, just like Williams, and his leading edge manages to evade Axar who was running back
pushed through full on the stumps, Chibhabha manages to stay leg side of it and drive inside out through the covers. Been very good with that tactic
powered away off the back foot as this back of a length ball has width outside off
theres his fifty. Its been a pretty good one for his side. Meets the fuller delivery with a straight bat and finds a single to long-on
low full toss outside off, slugged to wide long-on
full on off stump, drilled to the left of cover. But Jinxy the cat make another appearance.
keeps it full, but its also wide. Chibhabha slashes it behind point and with third man up in the circle, there was only one place this ball was headed
jumps down the track to turn an attemped yorker into a full toss and flicks it to deep midwicket. Sandy finishes with an economy rate over 9
carves a fuller ball from outside off to deep midwicket. Think he tried to hit it a bit too hard, so couldnt get the timing
looks for the wide yorker, ends up being a loopy one. Coventry jams his bat down and can only block it. For something of a big hitter, hes not having the best of days...

puts him out of his misery. A laboured innings of 4 off 10. This was a good length ball angled in sharply at him. Coventry looks for a flick, but is into the shot too early. First appeal is for leg before, and he looks quite plumb too. Caught in the crease, playing around his pads
full and targeting the leg stump again. Ervine looks for a flick with fine leg up on the circle, doesnt connect

outside edge beats a backtracking Rahane at cover. Looked to take a good length ball from outside off and whip it over midwicket. Odd choice of shot, considering he was playing so well through the covers
was looking for a pull, but it seems to skid in off the deck and stay slightly slow as well. Wears it on the thighs
good take behind the stumps as Uthappa dives a long way to his right after Bhuvi strays too far down leg
fuller delivery on off stump, steps forward to block
stays low, because of the lack of pace hes put on the ball. Chibhabha stays put in his crease to play a slog through midwicket. But the legcutter beats the bottom edge
legcutter beats Chibhabha and sneaks under the bat. Funnily enough it doesnt deviate the first time it pitches, but it does after it passes the bat and puts Uthappa in a spot of bother
sliced away over short third man, its throw your bat at the ball time. Who cares about the pretty balance he had earlier in the innings
fuller and wider outside off, slashed down to third man
presents a length ball which has been walloped away to the midwicket boundary. Picked the slower ball and timed it excellently
lands this slower ball better. Fuller than the last one and it was cramping him for room. Chibhabha, despite having picked it, can only clip it to long-on. Thats his highest score in T20Is
mid-off was up, which means this length ball was basically a free hit. Willams leans forward and belts the ball down the ground
saw the batsman charging, immediately resorts to his slower ball and shortens his length as well. Pulls to deep square leg
oh dear, hes left the short ball go outside off. Ruefully practices the ramp shot. Had expected that short ball to bounce higher so that it could be a wide
thats the short ball off his normal pace, pulled away to deep square leg

squirts through his legs and then its timber! Lovely bowling from Bhuvi as he goes for the yorker and angles it in as well. Chibhabha had moved across on off stump to try and flick the ball away, but it breaches his defences. When it doubt, go for the inswinging yorker
back of a length and outside off, eased away to point for Waller to get off the mark
slower ball, pushed a bit too far wide of off stump. Ervine collects an extra
goes through the wicketkeeper this time. Thats five wides after it beats Ervines attempted drive through the covers. Uthappa may have got a bad bounce, but did he stay low enough?
full and wide outside off, jams his bat down and the ball pops over behind the wicket.
finishes with another yorker. Homing in on off stump, Williams plays with a closed face and cannot get his bat down in time or in line with the ball
gets a low full toss on off stump, worked away through midwicket
looks for the blockhole again and the batsman just about manages to push it into the covers
starts off very well as he lands a yorker on fourth stump. The batsman was standing deep in his crease and was trying to smear it through extra. Cant connect
slower ball, fuller and wider outside off, bunted down to long-off
goes for a pull, but the short ball got a bit too big on him. Not enough room to free the arms either and gets a top edge. Simpe catch for midwicket running in from the deep
full on the base of off stump, squeezed through point
slower short ball outside off, dragged to deep midwicket
back of the hand slower ball sneaks through the batsmans slog, bounces over the stumps and becomes a dot ball. Good over from Mohit, good work from Bhuvi in the penultimate over as well
